formalpara.title: Figure 1. The core sex determination pathway
formalpara.para: Proteins are shown in capital letters, and are indicated when the regulatory interactions are known to take place at this level; in all other cases, gene names are used and are shown in italics. Positive interactions are indicated with an arrow, and negative ones by a “--|”. Genes that promote spermatogenesis are blue, and those that promote oogenesis are red. Not shown are sex-determination and dosage compensation genes that act upstream of HER-1, which also form part of the “global” sex determination pathway (see Somatic sex determination and X-chromosome dosage compensation).
